title: Vaal Dam full to bursting – see incredible photos and video!
text:
On Monday the department of water and sanitation confirmed the dam was at 100 percent – for the first time in six years.

Excitement ran high last week when it became known that the water level of the Vaal Dam had passed the 85 percent-full level. It was the highest level in two dry years.

Fantastic News: Vaal dam has reached 100% full for the first time in 6 years. pic.twitter.com/sBbwHg4XWd — Johannesburg Water (@JHBWater) February 27, 2017

#VaalDam is only 1 of 14 dams in the #Vaal river system - we still need to #SaveWater - #WaterShortage problems are far from over https://t.co/l5WTgTw85C — CICA - Crime Intel (@CICArsa) February 26, 2017

Spectators streamed to the dam to see the water mass with their own eyes. What a spectacle it was when Nomvula Mokonyane, minister of water and sanitation, opened two of the sluices to prevent the dam bursting due to the incredible water pressure. Read more: WATCH: Bakkie swept away in KZN flash floods But water users have been warned not to take the water for granted. The present water level doesn’t mean the end of the water shortage and we still have to be careful about how we use the available water.

2 Sluice gates opened at vaal Dam #Vaaldam Levels pic.twitter.com/dKWiqj2uId — Johannesburg Water (@JHBWater) February 26, 2017

Another angle of the #vaaldam gates being opened. Levels have reached 100% pic.twitter.com/uEbwEX0Cmf — Mpiletso Motumi (@mane_mpi) February 26, 2017

Eight of Bloemhof Dam’s sluices might also be opened. People have been warned that their opening could cause flooding.

Sources: ewn.co.za, enca.com, brakpanherald.co.za
